title: Analyst: Trump doesn't have the power to do what he's threatening
description: CNN legal analyst Elie Honig breaks down the legality of President Donald Trump's claims during a Fox News interview that there will be law enforcement sent to polling places on Election Day.

title: Runner spotted trying to stop spread of wildfire
description: Trevor Murphy was training for a 100-mile ultramarathon in Arizona's McDowell Mountain Regional Park when he spotted flames from a lightning-sparked wildfire. Murphy used his feet to create a firebreak to stop the blaze from spreading. He came away from the experience with a broken phone, melted shoes and singed hair. CNN affiliate KPHO has more.

title: What Steve Bannon arrest reveals about 'building the wall'
description: The arrest of Trump's ex-campaign chief and former White House advisor Steve Bannon, and three others, on federal charges that they defrauded those who donated to a nonprofit called -- wait for it -- We Build The Wall -- has added one more big name to the list of Trump-adjacent figures who have found trouble with the law.

title: JoJo Siwa is unrecognizable after this makeover
description: The kids' entertainment favorite and YouTube celebrity makeup artist James Charles gave each other makeovers in their signature styles.

title: Woman in Belarus tells CNN reporter to 'Leave, Satan'
description: Protests continue in Belarus as embattled President Alexander Lukashenko, who has has been in power for 26 years, is facing pressure from inside and outside the country to resign. CNN's Fred Pleitgen reports.

title: Melania Trump unveils White House restorations
description: First lady Melania Trump on Saturday unveiled the newly renovated White House Rose Garden, an iconic space that she will use as a backdrop for her upcoming speech to the Republican National Convention.

title: Thousands crowd into an indoor pop concert in experiment
description: Ever since the coronavirus pandemic shuttered clubs, bars and concert halls around the world, music fans have been dreaming of the day they can once again visit a busy, sweaty venue to enjoy a gig with friends.

title: Gulf Coast on alert as simultaneous tropical storms threaten
description: Gulf Coast residents need to pay attention as not one, but two tropical systems could impact the area in the coming days.

title: Highest daily spike in German cases since late April
Harris' husband Emhoff celebrates 'beautiful life' with VP nominee in 6th anniversary message
description: Doug Emhoff, Kamala Harris' husband, commemorated the couple's sixth wedding on Twitter Saturday, writing that he "wouldn't change a thing."

title: A 194-year-old apple tree, the matriarch of the Northwest apple industry, has died
description: An apple tree thought to be the oldest in the Pacific Northwest has died this summer at 194 years of age.

title: Amsterdam has been collapsing for years. Now it's paying the price.
description: Cracks and sinkholes are appearing alongside the waterways of Amsterdam.

title: Oh, great: NASA says an asteroid is headed our way right before Election Day
description: Well, 2020 keeps getting better all the time.

title: How a brand of chalk achieved cult status among mathematicians
description: Some call it the Rolls Royce of chalk, the Steinway of writing utensils. Some say it's unbreakable, others say it leaves no dust behind.

title: He's broken the world record aged 20, now he's being compared to Usain Bolt
Nearly 70,000 lives could be saved in the next 3 months if more Americans wore masks, researchers say
description: Another 134,000 people could die in the US from Covid-19 by December if no further safety measures are mandated -- and the actual number probably would be much worse if mandates are relaxed, researchers say.

title: Young voters prefer Biden, but they may not vote
description: There is good news for former Vice President Joe Biden when it comes to younger voters. He's no longer underperforming where Hillary Clinton ended up in the final 2016 polls.

title: Latino doctor volunteered for vaccine trial. See how it went
description: CNN en Español medical contributor Dr. Elmer Huerta volunteered to be part of the Moderna/NIH Stage 3 Covid-19 vaccine. The trial needs more minorities to enroll to avoid delays.

title: Justice Department says former Green Beret allegedly provided secrets to Russia
description: A former Army Green Beret has been charged with providing information about US national defenses to Russian agents, the Department of Justice announced on Friday.

title: Jack Sherman, an early guitarist with the Red Hot Chili Peppers, dies at 64
description: Jack Sherman, a guitarist who played on the Red Hot Chili Peppers' debut album, has died at 64, the band announced on Instagram.

title: Trump is leading Republicans to an unwanted record in the popular vote
description: American elections tend to swing on a pendulum. No one party usually holds power for too long. Since 1952, for example, only once has a party won the presidency three elections in a row.

title: An 18-year-old woman drowned near a Minnesota dam after carrying several children to safety, police say
description: Minnesota police say 18-year-old Raina Lynn Neeland drowned after carrying several children to safety who were near a dam.

title: Facebook wants to help build AI that can remember everything for you
description: On Friday, Facebook announced new AI research that could help pave the way for a significant change in how artificial intelligence — and some devices that incorporate this technology — functions in our daily lives.

title: Flames scorch roads in fires caused by lightning strikes
description: Nearly 11,000 lightning strikes have sparked 367 wildfires, with more than 300,000 acres burned across California, according to a Cal Fire spokesman. At least four blazes have already burned more than 150,000 acres in Colorado.

title: Despite effort, enrollment of minorities for coronavirus vaccine trial is lagging
description: Moderna, the first company to launch large-scale clinical trials for a coronavirus vaccine, has enrolled minorities at levels more than three times lower than those requested by Dr. Anthony Fauci, the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases.

title: Flight carrying comatose Russian dissident Navalny lands in Berlin
description: A medical evacuation flight carrying Alexey Navalny has left Omsk and is on its way to Germany, after the Russian opposition leader fell gravely ill in a suspected poisoning.

title: Mexico's solution to the Covid-19 educational crisis: Put school on television
description: The Jiménez family have their morning routine down to a science. Or at least, they used to.

title: These men received 505-year prison sentences each. Now their cases are under new scrutiny
description: On an August afternoon in 1991, a federal judge in California sent an unmistakable message in the "war on drugs" when he sentenced four men convicted of laundering cocaine cartel cash to more than 500 years each in prison.

title: Dark-skinned minorities: We're spat at
A Taco Bell employee saved a man's life after he passed out in the drive-thru
description: A Taco Bell employee in Tennessee is being hailed a hero for saving a man's life after he passed out in the drive-thru.

title: Trump's troops pullout plan under fire
Songbirds sing so loudly at dawn because they're warming up, study finds
description: Songbirds, they're just like us.

title: Court orders Trump to pay legal fees in Stormy Daniels suit
description: A California Superior Court judge has ordered President Donald Trump to pay $44,100 to Stephanie Clifford, also known as Stormy Daniels, to reimburse her attorneys' fees in the legal battle surrounding her nondisclosure agreement.

title: What Kamala Harris' Indian roots reveal about the US
description: When Shyamala Gopalan first came to the United States, there were only around 12,000 Indian immigrants living here.

title: Lori Loughlin and husband to serve prison time in college admissions scandal
description: Lori Loughlin, the famed actress who became the face of the college admissions scandal, is expected to be sentenced to prison on Friday, a fate she and her husband, Mossimo Giannulli, fought to avoid from the moment they were charged by federal authorities.

title: Harris' reacts after Trump 'nasty' jibe
description: In their first joint interview since the 2020 Democratic National Convention, Joe Biden and Kamala Harris responded to President Trump's comments calling Harris "nasty."
